title: Colossians Chapter 4 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Colossians chapter 4 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Colossians Chapter 4 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Colossians Chapter 4.

questions.question: According to Colossians 4:1, what should masters give unto their servants?
options: That which is just and equal
questions.correctAnswer: That which is just and equal
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:1 instructs masters to give unto their servants that which is just and equal.

questions.question: What does Colossians 4:2 encourage believers to continue in?
questions.correctAnswer: Prayer and watching with thanksgiving
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:2 encourages believers to continue in prayer and watch in the same with thanksgiving.

questions.question: Who does Paul say will declare his state to the Colossians in Colossians 4:7?
questions.correctAnswer: Tychicus
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:7 states that Tychicus will declare Paul's state to the Colossians.

questions.question: Who is described as a faithful and beloved brother in Colossians 4:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Onesimus
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:9 describes Onesimus as a faithful and beloved brother.

questions.question: According to Colossians 4:5, how should believers walk toward them that are without?
questions.correctAnswer: In wisdom
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:5 instructs believers to walk in wisdom toward them that are without.

questions.question: What is Paul's request in Colossians 4:3 for those praying for him?
options: That God would open a door of utterance for the mystery of Christ
That he might be freed from prison
That the Colossians would give more offerings
questions.correctAnswer: That God would open a door of utterance for the mystery of Christ
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:3 asks for prayer that God would open a door of utterance to speak the mystery of Christ.

questions.question: What kind of speech does Colossians 4:6 advise believers to have?
options: Speech always with grace, seasoned with salt
Speech that is loud and commanding
questions.correctAnswer: Speech always with grace, seasoned with salt
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:6 advises that speech be always with grace and seasoned with salt.

questions.question: Who is called the beloved physician in Colossians 4:14?
questions.correctAnswer: Luke
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:14 refers to Luke as the beloved physician.

questions.question: Where does Colossians 4:15 instruct the epistle to be read besides the Colossian church?
options: In the church of the Laodiceans
questions.correctAnswer: In the church of the Laodiceans
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:16 instructs that this epistle be read also in the church of the Laodiceans.

questions.question: What warning or instruction is given to Archippus in Colossians 4:17?
options: Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received
questions.correctAnswer: Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:17 tells Archippus to take heed to the ministry he has received in the Lord.

questions.question: True or False: According to Colossians 4:12, Epaphras laboring fervently in prayers is for the Colossians to stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:12 states that Epaphras labors fervently in prayers for the Colossians to stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.

questions.question: True or False: Colossians 4:10 mentions that Marcus is the sister's son to Barnabas.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:10 mentions that Marcus is the sister's son to Barnabas.

questions.question: True or False: Colossians 4:18 ends with Paul asking the readers to forget his bonds.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:18 asks the readers to remember Paul's bonds, not forget them.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Colossians 4:6: 'Let your speech be alway with ______, seasoned with salt.'
questions.correctAnswer: grace
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:6 says 'Let your speech be alway with grace, seasoned with salt.'

questions.question: Complete the greeting in Colossians 4:14: 'Luke, the beloved _______, and Demas, greet you.'
questions.correctAnswer: physician
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:14 refers to Luke as the beloved physician.

medium.title: Colossians Chapter 4 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Colossians Chapter 4 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Colossians 4:2 teach us to cultivate a strong prayer life?
options: By continuing in prayer and watching with thanksgiving
By praying only when in need
questions.correctAnswer: By continuing in prayer and watching with thanksgiving
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:2 instructs believers to be persistent in prayer and remain watchful while giving thanks. This shows the importance of consistency and gratitude in prayer life, also supported by verses emphasizing wisdom and grace in speech (4:5-6) and fervent labor in prayer (4:12).

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to share the Gospel boldly. Based on Colossians 4, what encouragement can you give them?
options: Pray that God opens a door for utterance to speak the mystery of Christ
Speak only when you feel confident
Avoid sharing the Gospel to prevent conflict
Focus on good works instead of words
questions.correctAnswer: Pray that God opens a door for utterance to speak the mystery of Christ
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:3-4 highlights the importance of praying for God to open doors to speak clearly and boldly about Christ’s mystery, encouraging believers to rely on God's enabling in evangelism.

questions.question: What practical advice does Colossians 4:5 give about interacting wisely with non-believers?
options: Walk in wisdom toward them, redeeming the time
questions.correctAnswer: Walk in wisdom toward them, redeeming the time
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:5 encourages believers to act wisely with those outside the faith, making the most of every opportunity. This wisdom includes gracious speech (4:6) and living with integrity (4:1).

questions.question: According to Colossians 4:6, how should Christian speech be characterized when answering others?
options: Always with grace, seasoned with salt
questions.correctAnswer: Always with grace, seasoned with salt
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:6 teaches that speech should be gracious and thoughtful ('seasoned with salt'), enabling believers to answer everyone appropriately and lovingly, reflecting humility and wisdom.

questions.question: How does Colossians 4:1 instruct masters in their relationship with servants?
options: Give them what is just and equal, knowing you also have a Master in heaven
Ignore their needs and focus on work
questions.correctAnswer: Give them what is just and equal, knowing you also have a Master in heaven
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:1 reminds masters to act justly and fairly toward their servants, recognizing that they too are accountable to God, promoting integrity and fairness in work relationships.

questions.question: What example of fervent prayer and labor for others is given in Colossians 4:12-13?
options: Epaphras, who labors fervently in prayers for the believers’ perfection
questions.correctAnswer: Epaphras, who labors fervently in prayers for the believers’ perfection
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:12-13 describes Epaphras as a servant of Christ, fervently praying for the believers to stand perfect and complete in God's will, highlighting perseverance and intercession in trials.

questions.question: True or False: According to Colossians 4:10, believers are encouraged to receive Marcus if he comes to them.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:10 instructs that Marcus, the sister's son to Barnabas, should be received if he comes, showing the importance of hospitality and obedience to apostolic guidance.

questions.question: Who is described in Colossians 4:14 as a beloved physician who greets the believers?
questions.correctAnswer: Luke
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:14 refers to Luke as the beloved physician, highlighting his role and affectionate relationship with the believers, encouraging us to value faithful servants in the church.

questions.question: Based on Colossians 4:15, what is significant about Nymphas and the church in his house?
options: They are greeted by Paul and part of the local fellowship
They were recently founded by Paul
They are to be avoided due to false teaching
questions.correctAnswer: They are greeted by Paul and part of the local fellowship
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:15 shows Paul sending greetings to the brethren in Laodicea and to Nymphas and the church in his house, illustrating the importance of home churches and fellowship.

questions.question: How does Colossians 4:16 instruct the churches regarding the epistle?
options: Read this epistle among you and also in the church of the Laodiceans, and read the epistle from Laodicea
Keep the epistle private and secret
Only the leaders should read the epistle
questions.correctAnswer: Read this epistle among you and also in the church of the Laodiceans, and read the epistle from Laodicea
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:16 encourages mutual reading of epistles between churches, promoting unity and shared teaching in the body of Christ.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Colossians 4:18 ends with Paul reminding the believers to remember his _____ and wishing them grace.
questions.correctAnswer: bonds
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:18 shows Paul signing off by reminding them to remember his bonds (imprisonment) and offering grace, emphasizing perseverance and grace under trial.

questions.question: According to Colossians 4:7-9, what qualities describe Tychicus and Onesimus as they are sent to the believers?
options: Beloved, faithful ministers and fellowservants in the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Beloved, faithful ministers and fellowservants in the Lord
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:7-9 describes Tychicus and Onesimus as beloved and faithful ministers, sent to comfort and inform the believers, illustrating servant leadership and fellowship.

questions.question: True or False: Colossians 4:17 instructs Archippus to be cautious and fulfill the ministry he received in the Lord.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:17 calls Archippus to take heed and fulfill his ministry, emphasizing faithfulness and responsibility in serving God’s work.

questions.question: What attitude toward time management and opportunity does Colossians 4:5 promote for believers in their daily lives?
options: Redeeming the time by walking in wisdom toward outsiders
questions.correctAnswer: Redeeming the time by walking in wisdom toward outsiders
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:5 teaches believers to wisely manage their time and opportunities to witness and live godly lives before outsiders, demonstrating stewardship of time.

questions.question: How does Colossians 4:1 relate to the Christian work ethic and integrity?
options: Masters must give just and equal treatment to servants, remembering their own accountability to God
Masters should demand more work without regard to fairness
Servants have no rights in the workplace
Work performance is irrelevant to faith
questions.correctAnswer: Masters must give just and equal treatment to servants, remembering their own accountability to God
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:1 underscores fairness and justice in work relationships, reminding masters of their heavenly Master and promoting integrity and respect in the workplace.

hard.title: Colossians Chapter 4 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Colossians Chapter 4.

questions.question: In Colossians 4:1, what reason does Paul give for masters to treat their servants justly and equally?
options: Because they also have a Master in heaven
Because servants are part of the family
Because it promotes peace in the household
Because servants can leave if treated poorly
questions.correctAnswer: Because they also have a Master in heaven
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:1 reminds masters to treat their servants fairly, knowing that they themselves have a Master in heaven, establishing a theological accountability.

questions.question: What is the literary function of 'prayer' in the opening verses of Colossians 4:2-4?
options: It frames Paul's requests and instructions with spiritual urgency
It acts as a metaphor for faith
It introduces a new topic unrelated to the previous chapter
It highlights the superiority of prayer over works
questions.correctAnswer: It frames Paul's requests and instructions with spiritual urgency
questions.explanation: Verses 2-4 establish prayer both as a continuous spiritual discipline and as a means for Paul to ask for divine opportunity to preach, showing the centrality of prayer in the letter's exhortations.

questions.question: The phrase 'redeeming the time' in Colossians 4:5 is best understood in the original Greek context as:
options: Making the most of every opportunity
questions.correctAnswer: Making the most of every opportunity
questions.explanation: The Greek word 'exagorazō' used here literally means 'to buy out' or 'redeem,' metaphorically urging believers to wisely use their time, especially in evangelistic contexts.

questions.question: Which literary device is evident in Colossians 4:6, where speech is described as 'seasoned with salt'?
questions.correctAnswer: Metaphor
questions.explanation: The expression 'speech seasoned with salt' metaphorically suggests that believers' words should be gracious and preserving, adding flavor and wisdom to conversations.

questions.question: Tychicus, mentioned in Colossians 4:7-8, serves what primary role in the letter's context?
options: Faithful minister and fellow servant sent to inform the Colossians
A financial sponsor of Paul's ministry
A critic of the Colossian church
The original author of the epistle
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful minister and fellow servant sent to inform the Colossians
questions.explanation: Paul describes Tychicus as a beloved brother and faithful minister sent to update the Colossians on Paul's situation and to comfort their hearts.

questions.question: What is the significance of Onesimus being described as 'one of you' in Colossians 4:9?
options: It indicates his conversion and acceptance into the Colossian church
It implies he was a former slave still owned by Colossians
It means he was physically from Colossae but not a believer
It shows he was a messenger from another city
questions.correctAnswer: It indicates his conversion and acceptance into the Colossian church
questions.explanation: Onesimus, previously a runaway slave, is now called 'one of you,' signifying his new identity as a brother in Christ and member of the Colossian community.

questions.question: How does Paul's mention of Aristarchus and Marcus in Colossians 4:10 relate to the broader historical context of early Christian ministry?
options: They were trusted companions who often traveled and ministered with Paul, reflecting early Christian community networks
They were Roman officials opposing Paul
They were members of the Jewish Sanhedrin
They were fictional characters representing believers
questions.correctAnswer: They were trusted companions who often traveled and ministered with Paul, reflecting early Christian community networks
questions.explanation: Aristarchus and Marcus were known associates of Paul, illustrating the interconnected missionary efforts and support networks within the early church.

questions.question: The reference to 'those of the circumcision' in Colossians 4:11 primarily indicates:
options: Jewish Christians who observe the Mosaic Law
Gentile believers who adopted Jewish customs
questions.correctAnswer: Jewish Christians who observe the Mosaic Law
questions.explanation: The phrase 'of the circumcision' identifies Jewish believers who maintained their cultural identity within the early church, highlighting the diversity of backgrounds in ministry.

questions.question: Epaphras's role described in Colossians 4:12 includes which of the following?
options: Fervent labor in prayers for the Colossians’ spiritual maturity
questions.correctAnswer: Fervent labor in prayers for the Colossians’ spiritual maturity
questions.explanation: Epaphras is commended for his zealous prayers and labor to help the believers stand perfect and complete in God's will, emphasizing his pastoral dedication.

questions.question: Which cities are associated with Epaphras's zeal as noted in Colossians 4:13?
questions.correctAnswer: Colossae, Laodicea, and Hierapolis
questions.explanation: Paul notes Epaphras's zeal for the believers not only in Colossae but also in neighboring cities Laodicea and Hierapolis, indicating his regional pastoral concern.

questions.question: Luke, mentioned in Colossians 4:14, is best known in the New Testament as:
options: The beloved physician and author of Luke-Acts
A leader of the Jerusalem church
questions.correctAnswer: The beloved physician and author of Luke-Acts
questions.explanation: Luke is traditionally identified as the physician and gospel writer, and his greeting here connects the epistle to the wider New Testament authorship and ministry.

questions.question: What does the instruction in Colossians 4:16 about reading the epistle in Laodicea suggest about early Christian letter circulation?
options: Letters were shared and read publicly among different churches
Each church only read letters written specifically to them
Letters were kept private and not shared
Only apostles could read the letters
questions.correctAnswer: Letters were shared and read publicly among different churches
questions.explanation: Paul directs that this letter be read in Laodicea and that the letter from Laodicea be read in Colossae, indicating a practice of communal sharing of apostolic writings.

questions.question: The exhortation to Archippus in Colossians 4:17 can be seen as an example of which biblical literary device?
options: Personal admonition within a public letter
questions.correctAnswer: Personal admonition within a public letter
questions.explanation: Paul gives Archippus a direct, personal charge about his ministry, showing an intimate pastoral concern embedded in the letter's broader communal address.

questions.question: True or False: According to Colossians 4:18, Paul personally wrote the salutation by his own hand as a mark of authenticity.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Paul states that the salutation is by his own hand to authenticate the letter and remind recipients of his imprisonment, a common practice among Paul’s epistles.

questions.question: Which theme prevalent throughout Scripture is also emphasized by Paul's repeated mention of prayer in Colossians 4:2-4 and 12?
options: Dependence on God’s empowerment for ministry
Wealth accumulation as a sign of blessing
questions.correctAnswer: Dependence on God’s empowerment for ministry
questions.explanation: Paul's emphasis on continuous prayer and intercession reflects the biblical theme that effective ministry depends on God's enabling power rather than human effort alone.

theological.title: Colossians Chapter 4 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Colossians Chapter 4 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Colossians 4:1, what is the reason masters should give their servants what is just and equal?
options: Because servants have rights under the law
Because masters will be judged by their earthly authorities
Because masters also have a Master in heaven
Because it is a cultural expectation
questions.correctAnswer: Because masters also have a Master in heaven
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:1 instructs masters to give servants what is just and equal, knowing that they too have a Master in heaven. This reminds believers of accountability before God (cf. Ephesians 6:9; Matthew 7:12; James 5:4; 1 Peter 2:18).

questions.question: What does Paul exhort believers to do continually in Colossians 4:2?
options: Continue in prayer and watching with thanksgiving
Continue in studying the Law and prophets
questions.correctAnswer: Continue in prayer and watching with thanksgiving
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:2 commands believers to be steadfast in prayer and vigilant with thanksgiving, emphasizing perseverance in communion with God (cf. 1 Thessalonians 5:17; Philippians 4:6; Psalm 105:1; Ephesians 6:18).

questions.question: In Colossians 4:3, for what does Paul specifically ask the believers to pray?
options: That God would heal the sick among them
That God would open a door of utterance for the mystery of Christ
That they may receive material blessings
questions.correctAnswer: That God would open a door of utterance for the mystery of Christ
questions.explanation: Paul requests prayer that God would open a door of speech so he can clearly declare the mystery of Christ, highlighting the importance of evangelistic proclamation (cf. 1 Corinthians 2:1-5; Ephesians 6:19-20; Acts 28:31; 2 Corinthians 4:4).

questions.question: What manner of conduct does Paul urge toward outsiders in Colossians 4:5?
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom and redeeming the time
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:5 instructs believers to walk wisely toward outsiders and make the most of every opportunity, reflecting Christlike witness (cf. Ephesians 5:15-16; Proverbs 3:13; Matthew 10:16; 1 Peter 3:15).

questions.question: How should believers' speech be characterized according to Colossians 4:6?
questions.correctAnswer: Graceful and seasoned with salt
questions.explanation: Paul calls for speech filled with grace and seasoned with salt, meaning it should be gracious, wise, and engaging, enabling believers to respond appropriately to all (cf. Ephesians 4:29; Proverbs 15:1; Colossians 3:16; Matthew 5:13).

questions.question: Who does Paul describe as a beloved brother, faithful minister, and fellowservant in the Lord in Colossians 4:7?
questions.correctAnswer: Tychicus
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:7 introduces Tychicus as a beloved brother and faithful minister, demonstrating the importance of trustworthy coworkers in ministry (cf. Ephesians 6:21; Acts 20:4; 2 Timothy 4:12; Titus 3:13).

questions.question: What purpose did Paul have in sending Tychicus to the Colossians according to Colossians 4:8?
options: To collect financial support for Paul
To know their estate and comfort their hearts
questions.correctAnswer: To know their estate and comfort their hearts
questions.explanation: Paul sent Tychicus to learn about the believers' condition and to encourage them, reflecting pastoral care and concern (cf. Philippians 2:25; Acts 18:5; 2 Corinthians 1:6; Romans 16:1-2).

questions.question: Who is described as a faithful and beloved brother, one of the Colossians, in Colossians 4:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Onesimus
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:9 mentions Onesimus as a faithful and beloved brother who is one of the Colossians, highlighting transformation and reconciliation in Christ (cf. Philemon 10; Luke 19:10; 2 Timothy 4:11; Hebrews 13:2).

questions.question: In Colossians 4:10, who is identified as Paul's fellow prisoner and what instruction is given regarding Marcus?
options: Aristarchus is the fellow prisoner; receive Marcus if he comes to you
Onesimus is the fellow prisoner; send Marcus away
Tychicus is the fellow prisoner; ignore Marcus
Epaphras is the fellow prisoner; Marcus is not mentioned
questions.correctAnswer: Aristarchus is the fellow prisoner; receive Marcus if he comes to you
questions.explanation: Paul identifies Aristarchus as his fellow prisoner and instructs the Colossians to welcome Marcus if he visits, demonstrating Christian hospitality and reconciliation (cf. Acts 19:29; 2 Timothy 4:11; Philemon 24; Romans 16:7).

questions.question: Who are called Paul's fellowworkers unto the kingdom of God and a comfort to him in Colossians 4:11?
options: Aristarchus, Marcus, and Jesus called Justus
questions.correctAnswer: Aristarchus, Marcus, and Jesus called Justus
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:11 refers to Aristarchus, Marcus, and Jesus called Justus as fellowworkers who comfort Paul, underscoring partnership in God’s kingdom (cf. Philemon 24; Acts 20:4; 2 Timothy 4:11; Romans 16:21).

questions.question: What is Epaphras described as doing fervently in prayer for the Colossians in Colossians 4:12?
options: Praying for their perfection and completeness in God's will
questions.correctAnswer: Praying for their perfection and completeness in God's will
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:12 states Epaphras labors fervently in prayer for the believers to stand perfect and complete in God's will, emphasizing spiritual maturity (cf. Philippians 1:6; James 1:4; 2 Corinthians 13:9; Hebrews 6:1).

questions.question: What does Paul bear witness to regarding Epaphras in Colossians 4:13?
options: His great zeal for the Colossians and neighboring cities
questions.correctAnswer: His great zeal for the Colossians and neighboring cities
questions.explanation: Paul testifies to Epaphras's great zeal for the Colossians and for those in Laodicea and Hierapolis, showing pastoral concern beyond one community (cf. Jeremiah 20:9; Romans 12:11; Titus 2:14; 1 Corinthians 16:10).

questions.question: Who are the two individuals greeted by Paul in Colossians 4:14, and how are they described?
options: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas
Tychicus, the faithful minister, and Aristarchus
Marcus, the apostle, and Jesus called Justus
questions.correctAnswer: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:14 sends greetings from Luke, described as the beloved physician, and Demas, indicating valued ministry partners (cf. 2 Timothy 4:11; Philemon 24; Acts 16:10; 1 Corinthians 4:17).

questions.question: What instruction is given concerning the epistle in Colossians 4:16?
options: It should be read only in Colossae
It should be read also in the church of the Laodiceans and they should read the epistle from Laodicea
It should be kept private among the elders
It should be read only by those in authority
questions.correctAnswer: It should be read also in the church of the Laodiceans and they should read the epistle from Laodicea
questions.explanation: Paul instructs that this letter be read in Laodicea and that the Colossians read the letter from Laodicea, promoting mutual edification among churches (cf. 1 Corinthians 16:1-3; Revelation 3:14-22; Romans 16:1-5; 2 Timothy 4:13).

questions.question: To whom does Paul specifically command to 'take heed to the ministry' he received in Colossians 4:17?
questions.correctAnswer: Archippus
questions.explanation: Colossians 4:17 instructs Archippus to be diligent in fulfilling the ministry he received, highlighting personal responsibility in service (cf. 2 Timothy 4:5; 1 Timothy 4:16; Romans 12:11; 1 Corinthians 9:16).
